RT   arise from an amino acid substitution on glycophorin A.";
RL   Vox Sang. 78:52-56(2000).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Glycophorin A is the major intrinsic membrane protein of
CC       the erythrocyte. The N-terminal glycosylated segment, which lies
CC       outside the erythrocyte membrane, has MN blood group receptors.
CC       Appears to be important for the function of SLC4A1 and is required
CC       for high activity of SLC4A1. May be involved in translocation of
CC       SLC4A1 to the plasma membrane. Is a receptor for influenza virus.
CC       Is a receptor for Plasmodium falciparum erythrocyte-binding
CC       antigen 175 (EBA-175); binding of EBA-175 is dependent on sialic
CC       acid residues of the O-linked glycans. Appears to be a receptor
CC       for Hepatitis A virus (HAV).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. Interacts with Streptococcus gordonii hsa
CC       protein.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Self; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-702665, EBI-702665;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Single-pass type I membrane
CC       protein. Note=Appears to be colocalized with SLC4A1.
CC   -!- PTM: The major O-linked glycan are NeuAc-alpha-(2-3)-Gal-beta-(1-
CC       3)-[NeuAc-alpha-(2-6)]-GalNacOH (about 78 %) and NeuAc-alpha-(2-
CC       3)-Gal-beta-(1-3)-GalNAcOH (17 %). Minor O-glycans (5 %) include
CC       NeuAc-alpha-(2-3)-Gal-beta-(1-3)-[NeuAc-alpha-(2-6)]-GalNAcOH
CC       NeuAc-alpha-(2-8)-NeuAc-alpha-(2-3)-Gal-beta-(1-3)-GalNAcOH. About
CC       1% of all O-linked glycans carry blood group A, B and H
CC       determinants. They derive from a type-2 precursor core structure,
CC       Gal-beta-(1,3)-GlcNAc-beta-1-R, and the antigens are synthesized
CC       by addition of fucose (H antigen-specific) and then N-
CC       acetylgalactosamine (A antigen-specific) or galactose (B antigen-
CC       specific). Specifically O-linked-glycans are NeuAc-alpha-(2-3)-
CC       Gal-beta-(1-3)-GalNAcOH-(6-1)-GlcNAc-beta-(4-1)-[Fuc-alpha-(1-2)]-
CC       Gal-beta-(3-1)-GalNAc-alpha (about 1%, B antigen-specific) and
CC       NeuAc-alpha-(2-3)-Gal-beta-(1-3)-GalNAcOH-(6-1)-GlcNAc-beta-(4-1)-
CC       [Fuc-alpha-(1-2)]-Gal-beta (1 %, O antigen-, A antigen- and B
CC       antigen-specific).
CC   -!- POLYMORPHISM: Along with GYPB, GYPA is responsible for the MNS
CC       blood group system. The molecular basis of the GPA M/N bloodgroup
CC       antigen is a variation at positions 20 and 24. Ser-20 and Gly-24
CC       correspond to M (shown); 'Leu-20' and 'Glu-24' correspond to N.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Involved in several unequal homologous
CC       recombinations or gene conversion events, predominantly with GYPB
CC       and more rarely with GYPE. The resulting fusion proteins are
CC       observed in different phenotypes and encode low incidence
CC       bloodgroup antigens.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycophorin A family.
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=dbRBC/BGMUT; Note=Blood group antigen gene
CC       mutation database;
CC       URL="http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gv/mhc/xslcgi.cgi?cmd=bgmut/systems_info&system=mns";
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RP   DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.
RX   PubMed=12940824; DOI=10.1046/j.1365-2443.2003.00674.x;
RA   Arimitsu N., Akimitsu N., Kotani N., Takasaki S., Kina T.,
RA   Hamamoto H., Kamura K., Sekimizu K.;
RT   "Glycophorin A requirement for expression of O-linked antigens on the
RT   erythrocyte membrane.";
RL   Genes Cells 8:769-777(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Glycophorin A is the major intrinsic membrane
CC       sialoglycoprotein of the erythrocyte. Appears to be important for
CC       the function of SLC4A1 and is required for high activity of
CC       SLC4A1. May be involved in translocation of SLC4A1 to the plasma
CC       membrane (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Single-pass type III membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- PTM: The N-terminal extracellular domain is heavily glycosylated
CC       on serine and threonine residues (By similarity).
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: The amount of O-linked oligosaccharide
CC       chains in the erythrocyte membrane decreases to 60% compared to
CC       that of the wild-type mice. Erythrocytes lacking GPA are more
CC       sensitive to hypo-osmotic stress.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycophorin-A family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   -!- FUNCTION: This protein is a minor sialoglycoprotein in human

CC       important role in regulating the stability of red cells.

RP   REVIEW ON THE MEMBRANE STRUCTURE.
RX   MEDLINE=20553697; PubMed=11101882; DOI=10.1038/81914;

RL   Nat. Struct. Biol. 7:1082-1084(2000).
RN   [12]
RP   SELECTIVITY OF THE WATER CHANNEL.
RX   MEDLINE=21962462; PubMed=11964478; DOI=10.1126/science.1067778;
RA   Tajkhorshid E., Nollert P., Jensen M.O., Miercke L.J.,
RA   O'Connell J.D. III, Stroud R.M., Schulten K.;
RT   "Control of the selectivity of the aquaporin water channel family by
RT   global orientational tuning.";
RL   Science 296:525-530(2002).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Transporter of glycerol across the cytoplasmic membrane,
CC       with limited permeability to water and small uncharged compounds
CC       such as polyols.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 2 magnesium ions per subunit.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotetramer (Potential).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Aquaporins contain two tandem repeats each containing
CC       three membrane-spanning domains and a pore-forming loop with the
CC       signature motif Asn-Pro-Ala (NPA).
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The remarkable property of effective water
CC       conductance combined with a strict exclusion of all ions including
CC       protons is mediated by two conserved asparagines which force a
CC       central water molecule to serve strictly as a hydrogen bond donor
CC       to its neighboring water molecules. Assisted by the electrostatic
CC       potential generated by two half-membrane spanning loops, this
CC       dictates opposite orientations of water molecules in the two
CC       halves of the channel, and thus prevents the formation of a
CC       "proton wire", while permitting rapid water diffusion.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the MIP/aquaporin (TC 1.A.8) family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RP   FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=18842713; DOI=10.1128/JVI.01604-08;
RA   Bukreyev A., Yang L., Fricke J., Cheng L., Ward J.M., Murphy B.R.,
RA   Collins P.L.;
RT   "The secreted form of respiratory syncytial virus G glycoprotein helps
RT   the virus evade antibody-mediated restriction of replication by acting
RT   as an antigen decoy and through effects on fc receptor-bearing
RT   leukocytes.";
RL   J. Virol. 82:12191-12204(2008).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Attaches the virion to the host cell membrane by
CC       interacting with heparan sulfate, initiating the infection.
CC       Interacts with host CX3CR1, the receptor for the CX3C chemokine
CC       fractalkine, to modulate the immune response and facilitate
CC       infection. Unlike the other paramyxovirus attachment proteins,
CC       lacks both neuraminidase and hemagglutinating activities.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Secreted glycoprotein G helps RSV escape antibody-
CC       dependent restriction of replication by acting as an antigen decoy
CC       and by modulating the activity of leukocytes bearing Fcgamma
CC       receptors.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homooligomer. Interacts (via N-terminus) with protein M.
CC       Interacts with protein F; this interaction occurs on the surface
CC       of infected cells. Interacts with protein SH. Interacts with host
CC       CX3CR1; this interaction modulates host immune response.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Virion membrane. Host cell surface.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform Secreted glycoprotein G: Secreted.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative initiation; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=Membrane-bound glycoprotein G;
CC         IsoId=P03423-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=Secreted glycoprotein G;
CC         IsoId=P03423-2; Sequence=VSP_036039;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Contains a linear heparin binding domain essential for
CC       virus attachment to the host.
CC   -!- PTM: May carry 40-80 separate O-linked carbohydrate chains
CC       distributed among the 91 serine and threonine residues.
CC   -!- PTM: Palmitylated.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the pneumoviruses glycoprotein G family.

RN   [4]
RP   SUBSTRATE SPECIFICITY.
RC   STRAIN=69A;
RX   MEDLINE=20043416; PubMed=10577484; DOI=10.1016/S0923-2508(99)00106-0;
RA   Melchers K., Schuhmacher A., Buhmann A., Weitzenegger T., Belin D.,
RA   Grau S., Ehrmann M.;
RT   "Membrane topology of CadA homologous P-type ATPase of Helicobacter
RT   pylori as determined by expression of phoA fusions in Escherichia coli
RT   and the positive inside rule.";
RL   Res. Microbiol. 150:507-520(1999).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Couples the hydrolysis of ATP with the transport of
CC       cadmium, zinc and cobalt out of the cell. This ion efflux may
CC       influence the activity of urease, which is essential for the
CC       survival of the bacterium in the gastric environment.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + H(2)O + Cd(2+)(In) = ADP + phosphate +
CC       Cd(2+)(Out).
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + H(2)O + Zn(2+)(In) = ADP + phosphate +
CC       Zn(2+)(Out).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the cation transport ATPase (P-type)
CC       family. Type IB subfamily.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 HMA domain.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the endoplasmic reticulum quality control
CC       (ERQC) system also called ER-associated degradation (ERAD)
CC       involved in ubiquitin-dependent degradation of missfolded
CC       endoplasmic reticulum proteins. Provides the core ubiquitin ligase
CC       (E3) activity in ERAD, recruiting QRI8/UBC7 for substrate
CC       ubiquitination.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Protein modification; protein ubiquitination.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms a stable ubiquitin-ligase complex with HRD3. The
CC       complex interacts with the ERAD substrates HMG1 and HMG2, as well
CC       as with CDC48 and DER1. Interacts also with its associated E2
CC       ubiquitin conjugating enzymes UBC1 and QRI8/UBC7.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q99220:YOS9; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-37613, EBI-34938;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein (Potential).
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Present with 2660 molecules/cell in log phase SD
CC       medium.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the HRD1 family.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 RING-type zinc finger.

RT   "Arabidopsis ORF clones.";
RL   Submitted (JUL-2005) to the EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ databases.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in the attachment of the Gal residue on the
CC       third xylosyl unit within the XXXG core structure of xyloglucan,
CC       the principal glycan that interlaces the cellulose microfibrils in
CC       plant cell wall. Interacts with actin and is required for the
CC       proper endomembrane organization and for the cell elongation. Not
CC       involved in the trafficking from the endoplasmic reticulum to the
CC       vacuoles.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Protein modification; protein glycosylation.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Golgi apparatus, Golgi stack membrane;
CC       Single-pass type II membrane protein.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Ubiquitous.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The cytoplasmic N-terminal domain interacts with actin,
CC       while the lumenal C-terminal domain contributes to the activity of
CC       xyloglucan galactosyltransferase.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycosyltransferase 47 family.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAD21751.1; Type=Erroneous gene model prediction;

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates the voltage-dependent potassium ion
CC       permeability of excitable membranes. Assuming opened or closed
CC       conformations in response to the voltage difference across the
CC       membrane, the protein forms a potassium-selective channel through
CC       which potassium ions may pass in accordance with their
CC       electrochemical gradient.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterotetramer of potassium channel proteins. Binds PDZ
CC       domains of DLG1, DLG2 and DLG4.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P78352:DLG4 (xeno); NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-631446, EBI-80389;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The N-terminus may be important in determining the rate of
CC       inactivation of the channel while the tail may play a role in
CC       modulation of channel activity and/or targeting of the channel to
CC       specific subcellular compartments.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The segment S4 is probably the voltage-sensor and is
CC       characterized by a series of positively charged amino acids at
CC       every third position.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the potassium channel family. A (Shaker)
CC       subfamily.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates the voltage-dependent potassium ion
CC       permeability of excitable membranes. Assuming opened or closed
CC       conformations in response to the voltage difference across the
CC       membrane, the protein forms a potassium-selective channel through
CC       which potassium ions may pass in accordance with their
CC       electrochemical gradient.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterotetramer of potassium channel proteins (By
CC       similarity).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=B;
CC         IsoId=P17970-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=A;
CC         IsoId=P17970-2; Sequence=VSP_000960;
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed in late embryos and pupae.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The N-terminus may be important in determining the rate of
CC       inactivation of the channel while the tail may play a role in
CC       modulation of channel activity and/or targeting of the channel to
CC       specific subcellular compartments.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The segment S4 is probably the voltage-sensor and
CC       is characterized by a series of positively charged amino acids at
CC       every third position.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the potassium channel family. B (Shab)
CC       subfamily.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA].
RC   STRAIN=Berkeley; TISSUE=Embryo;
RA   Stapleton M., Carlson J.W., Chavez C., Frise E., George R.A.,
RA   Pacleb J.M., Park S., Wan K.H., Yu C., Celniker S.E.;
RL   Submitted (JAN-2006) to the EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ databases.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates the voltage-dependent potassium ion
CC       permeability of excitable membranes. Assuming opened or closed
CC       conformations in response to the voltage difference across the
CC       membrane, the protein forms a potassium-selective channel through
CC       which potassium ions may pass in accordance with their
CC       electrochemical gradient. May play a role in the nervous system
CC       and in the regulation of beating frequency in pacemaker cells.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterotetramer of potassium channel proteins (By
CC       similarity).
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q9VBL2:CG5890-RA; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-145706, EBI-105608;
CC       Q9VYA8:Tango2; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-145706, EBI-95641;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P17971-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=P17971-2; Sequence=Not described;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The N-terminus may be important in determining the rate of
CC       inactivation of the channel while the tail may play a role in
CC       modulation of channel activity and/or targeting of the channel to
CC       specific subcellular compartments.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The segment S4 is probably the voltage-sensor and
CC       is characterized by a series of positively charged amino acids at
CC       every third position.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the potassium channel family. Shal
CC       subfamily.

RP   STRUCTURE BY NMR OF 378-397.
RX   MEDLINE=22017750; PubMed=12023222; DOI=10.1016/S0006-3495(02)75640-3;
RA   Ohlenschlaeger O., Hojo H., Ramachandran R., Goerlach M., Haris P.I.;
RT   "Three-dimensional structure of the S4-S5 segment of the Shaker
RT   potassium channel.";
RL   Biophys. J. 82:2995-3002(2002).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Voltage-dependent potassium channel involved in
CC       regulation of sleep need or efficiency. Mediates the voltage-
CC       dependent potassium ion permeability of excitable membranes.
CC       Assuming opened or closed conformations in response to the voltage
CC       difference across the membrane, the protein forms a potassium-
CC       selective channel through which potassium ions may pass in
CC       accordance with their electrochemical gradient.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The voltage-dependent potassium channel is a
CC       heterotetramer of potassium channel proteins (By similarity).
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       O46078-1:EG:39E1.1; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-85074, EBI-216413;
CC       Q9V375:l(2)02045; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-85074, EBI-128171;
CC       Q9VBN2:LpR2; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-85074, EBI-177565;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=7;
CC       Name=E;
CC         IsoId=P08510-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=Alpha; Synonyms=B, G, Adult;
CC         IsoId=P08510-2; Sequence=VSP_017889, VSP_000959;
CC       Name=Beta; Synonyms=C, Late population;
CC         IsoId=P08510-3; Sequence=VSP_000954;
CC       Name=Gamma;
CC         IsoId=P08510-4; Sequence=VSP_000955, VSP_000959;
CC       Name=Delta; Synonyms=Larval, A;
CC         IsoId=P08510-5; Sequence=VSP_000956, VSP_000957, VSP_000958;
CC       Name=Epsilon; Synonyms=Larval, F;
CC         IsoId=P08510-6; Sequence=VSP_000957, VSP_000958;
CC       Name=D;
CC         IsoId=P08510-7; Sequence=VSP_000956, VSP_017889, VSP_000959;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The segment S4 is probably the voltage-sensor and is
CC       characterized by a series of positively charged amino acids at
CC       every third position.
CC   -!- RNA EDITING: Modified_positions=178, 360, 464, 489, 491;
CC       Note=Partially edited.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Reduced sleep. Flies sleep for one-third of
CC       the wild-type amount. They perform normally in a number of tasks,
CC       have preserved sleep homeostasis, but are not impaired by sleep
CC       deprivation. They also have a reduced lifespan.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the potassium channel family. A (Shaker)
CC       subfamily.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAA70217.1; Type=Frameshift; Positions=Several;

RN   [2]
RP   FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=12629550; DOI=10.1038/nature01473;
RA   Ruta V., Jiang Y., Lee A., Chen J., MacKinnon R.;
RT   "Functional analysis of an archaebacterial voltage-dependent K+
RT   channel.";
RL   Nature 422:180-185(2003).
RN   [3]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.9 ANGSTROMS) OF 31-253.
RX   PubMed=12721618; DOI=10.1038/nature01580;
RA   Jiang Y., Lee A., Chen J., Ruta V., Cadene M., Chait B.T.,
RA   MacKinnon R.;
RT   "X-ray structure of a voltage-dependent K(+) channel.";
RL   Nature 423:33-41(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates a strong voltage-dependent potassium ion
CC       permeability of excitable membranes. Assuming opened or closed
CC       conformations in response to the voltage difference across the
CC       membrane, the protein forms a potassium-selective channel through
CC       which potassium ions may pass in accordance with their
CC       electrochemical gradient.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Contains a central ion-conduction pore surrounded by four
CC       voltage sensors which form the voltage-sensor paddles that move in
CC       response to membrane voltage changes through the fluid membrane
CC       interior, each voltage-sensor carrying their four positive charges
CC       across the membrane. It is thought that the S4 arginine residues
CC       move through the membrane's electric field to open the pore.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the potassium channel family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RX   MEDLINE=97446153; PubMed=9299337; DOI=10.1006/jmbi.1997.1224;
RA   Wang Y.-F., Dutzler R., Rizkallah P.J., Rosenbusch J.P., Schirmer T.;

RT   differential flux rates in maltoporin.";
RL   J. Mol. Biol. 272:56-63(1997).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in the transport of maltose and maltodextrins,
CC       indispensable for translocation of dextrins containing more than
CC       three glucosyl moieties. A hydrophobic path ("greasy slide") of
CC       aromatic residues serves to guide and select the sugars for
CC       transport through the channel. Also acts as a receptor for several
CC       bacteriophages including lambda.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotrimer formed of three 18-stranded antiparallel beta-
CC       barrels, containing three independent channels.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P10408:secA; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-371309, EBI-543213;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell outer membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By maltose.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the porin lamB (TC 1.B.3) family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of serine palmitoyltransferase (SPT), which
CC       catalyzes the committed step in the synthesis of sphingolipids,
CC       the condensation of serine with palmitoyl CoA to form the long
CC       chain base 3-ketosphinganine.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Palmitoyl-CoA + L-serine = CoA + 3-dehydro-D-
CC       sphinganine + CO(2).
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Pyridoxal phosphate.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Lipid metabolism; sphingolipid metabolism.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: LCB1 and LCB2 encode essential subunits of the enzyme and
CC       form a heterodimer. Interacts with LCB2 and TSC3.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P53090:ARO8; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-10059, EBI-2042933;
CC       P40970:LCB2; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-10059, EBI-10067;
CC       P36027:MID2; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-10059, EBI-10901;
CC       Q04947:RTN1; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-10059, EBI-38020;
CC       P14359:SNA3; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-10059, EBI-26122;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm. Endoplasmic reticulum membrane;
CC       Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The first transmembrane domain is not required for
CC       stability, membrane association, interaction with LCB2, or
CC       enzymatic activity. The second and third transmembrane domains are
CC       required for stability and interaction with LCB2.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Present with 22400 molecules/cell in log phase SD
CC       medium.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the class-II pyridoxal-phosphate-dependent
CC       aminotransferase family.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Antenna complexes are light-harvesting systems, which
CC       transfer the excitation energy to the reaction centers.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The core complex is formed by 9 alpha and 9 beta chains
CC       that bind bacteriochlorophyll and carotenoid molecules, and is
CC       disposed around the reaction center. The non-pigmented gamma
CC       chains may constitute additional components (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Single-pass type II
CC       membrane protein.

RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (3.3 ANGSTROMS) IN COMPLEX WITH GLUTATHIONE,
RP   ACTIVE SITE, TOPOLOGY, AND SUBUNIT.
RX   PubMed=17632548; DOI=10.1038/nature05936;
RA   Ago H., Kanaoka Y., Irikura D., Lam B.K., Shimamura T., Austen K.F.,
RA   Miyano M.;

RT   leukotriene biosynthesis.";
RL   Nature 448:609-612(2007).
RN   [14]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.0 ANGSTROMS) OF 2-150 IN COMPLEX WITH
RP   GLUTATHIONE, SUBUNIT, AND TOPOLOGY.
RX   PubMed=17632546; DOI=10.1038/nature06009;
RA   Martinez Molina D., Wetterholm A., Kohl A., McCarthy A.A.,
RA   Niegowski D., Ohlson E., Hammarberg T., Eshaghi S., Haeggstroem J.Z.,
RA   Nordlund P.;
RT   "Structural basis for synthesis of inflammatory mediators by human
RT   leukotriene C4 synthase.";
RL   Nature 448:613-616(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the conjugation of leukotriene A4 with reduced
CC       glutathione to form leukotriene C4.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Leukotriene C(4) = leukotriene A(4) +
CC       glutathione.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotrimer. Interacts with ALOX5AP and ALOX5.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus outer membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein. Endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Detected in lung, platelets and the
CC       myelogenous leukemia cell line KG-1 (at protein level). LTC4S
CC       activity is present in eosinophils, basophils, mast cells, certain
CC       phagocytic mononuclear cells, endothelial cells, vascular smooth
CC       muscle cells and platelets.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Defects in LTC4S are the cause of leukotriene C4 synthase
CC       deficiency (LTC4 synthase deficiency) [MIM:246530]. LTC4 synthase
CC       deficiency is a fatal neurometabolic developmental disorder. It is
CC       associated with muscular hypotonia, psychomotor retardation,
CC       failure to thrive, and microcephaly.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the MAPEG family.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates ATP-dependent export of organic anions and
CC       drugs from the cytoplasm. Hydrolyzes ATP with low efficiency.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + H(2)O + xenobiotic(In) = ADP + phosphate
CC       + xenobiotic(Out).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: In mouse the MDR gene family includes three or more
CC       related but distinct cellular genes.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the ABC transporter superfamily. ABCB
CC       family. Multidrug resistance exporter (TC 3.A.1.201) subfamily.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 ABC transmembrane type-1 domains.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 ABC transporter domains.

RP   FUNCTION AS AN ANTIBIOTIC EFFLUX PUMP.
RC   STRAIN=PAO6609;
RX   MEDLINE=94042912; PubMed=8226684;
RA   Poole K., Krebes K., McNally C., Neshat S.;
RT   "Multiple antibiotic resistance in Pseudomonas aeruginosa: evidence
RT   for involvement of an efflux operon.";
RL   J. Bacteriol. 175:7363-7372(1993).
RN   [6]
RP   FUNCTION IN ANTIBIOTIC EFFLUX AND ENERGETIC REQUIREMENTS.
RC   STRAIN=ATCC 15692 / PAO1 / 1C / PRS 101 / LMG 12228;
RX   MEDLINE=96050722; PubMed=8540696;
RA   Li X.-Z., Nikaido H., Poole K.;
RT   "Role of mexA-mexB-oprM in antibiotic efflux in Pseudomonas
RT   aeruginosa.";
RL   Antimicrob. Agents Chemother. 39:1948-1953(1995).
RN   [7]
RP   FUNCTION IN SOLVENT EFFLUX.
RC   STRAIN=ATCC 15692 / PAO1 / 1C / PRS 101 / LMG 12228;
RX   MEDLINE=98269018; PubMed=9603892;
RA   Li X.-Z., Zhang L., Poole K.;
RT   "Role of the multidrug efflux systems of Pseudomonas aeruginosa in
RT   organic solvent tolerance.";
RL   J. Bacteriol. 180:2987-2991(1998).
RN   [8]
RP   TOPOLOGY.
RC   STRAIN=PAO4290;
RX   MEDLINE=99214619; PubMed=10187844; DOI=10.1074/jbc.274.15.10517;
RA   Guan L., Ehrmann M., Yoneyama H., Nakae T.;
RT   "Membrane topology of the xenobiotic-exporting subunit, MexB, of the
RT   MexA,B-OprM extrusion pump in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 274:10517-10522(1999).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The inner membrane transporter component of the mexAB-
CC       oprM efflux system that confers multidrug resistance. Also
CC       functions as the major efflux pump for n-hexane and p-xylene
CC       efflux. Over-expression of the pump increases antibiotic and
CC       solvent efflux capacities. Implicated in the secretion of the
CC       siderophore pyoverdine.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The ability to export antibiotics and solvents is
CC       dramatically decreased in the presence of the proton conductor
CC       carbonyl cyanide m-chlorophenylhydrazone (CCCP), showing that an
CC       energized inner membrane is required for efflux. It is thought
CC       that the mexB subunit is a proton antiporter.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the mexAB-oprM multidrug efflux complex
CC       composed of an unknown number of mexA subunits, mexB and an oprM
CC       homotrimer. The mexA subunits are thought to form a barrel between
CC       the mexB inner membrane transporter and the trimeric oprM outer
CC       membrane channel protein which allows substrates to pass directly
CC       from the cytoplasm to the external mileu. How the mexA subunits
CC       interact with oprM and mexB, and how the oprM channel is opened is
CC       unknown.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By growth under severe iron limitation.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the acrB/acrD/acrF (TC 2.A.6) family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mediates export of organic anions and drugs from the
CC       cytoplasm. Mediates ATP-dependent transport of glutathione and
CC       glutathione conjugates, leukotriene C4, estradiol-17-beta-o-
CC       glucuronide, methotrexate, antiviral drugs and other xenobiotics.
CC       Confers resistance to anticancer drugs. Hydrolyzes ATP with low
CC       efficiency.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=9;
CC         Comment=Additional isoforms seem to exist. Experimental
CC         confirmation may be lacking for some isoforms;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=Allexons;
CC         IsoId=P33527-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Delexon-17;
CC         IsoId=P33527-2; Sequence=VSP_000037;
CC       Name=3; Synonyms=Delexon-18;
CC         IsoId=P33527-3; Sequence=VSP_000038;
CC       Name=4; Synonyms=Delexon-30;
CC         IsoId=P33527-4; Sequence=VSP_000039;
CC       Name=5; Synonyms=Delexon-17-18;
CC         IsoId=P33527-5; Sequence=VSP_000037, VSP_000038;
CC       Name=6; Synonyms=Delexon-17-30;
CC         IsoId=P33527-6; Sequence=VSP_000037, VSP_000039;
CC       Name=7; Synonyms=Delexon-18-30;
CC         IsoId=P33527-7; Sequence=VSP_000038, VSP_000039;
CC       Name=8; Synonyms=Delexon-17-18-30;
CC         IsoId=P33527-8; Sequence=VSP_000037, VSP_000038, VSP_000039;
CC       Name=9;
CC         IsoId=P33527-9; Sequence=VSP_017014;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Lung, testis and peripheral blood mononuclear
CC       cells.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the ABC transporter superfamily. ABCC
CC       family. Conjugate transporter (TC 3.A.1.208) subfamily.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 ABC transmembrane type-1 domains.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 ABC transporter domains.

CC       and Haematology;

FT                                anthracyclines.

FT                                estradiol glucuronide transport.

FT                                C4, estradiol glucuronide and of
FT                                glutathione.

CC       osmotic pressure changes within the cell.

RX   PubMed=12446901; DOI=10.1126/science.1077945;

RT   "Crystal structure of Escherichia coli MscS, a voltage-modulated and
RT   mechanosensitive channel.";
RL   Science 298:1582-1587(2002).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mechanosensitive channel that participates in the
CC       regulation of osmotic pressure changes within the cell, opening in
CC       response to stretch forces in the membrane lipid bilayer, without
CC       the need for other proteins. Forms an ion channel of 1.0
CC       nanosiemens conductance with a slight preference for anions. The
CC       channel is sensitive to voltage; as the membrane is depolarized,
CC       less tension is required to open the channel and vice versa. The
CC       channel is characterized by short bursts of activity that last for
CC       a few seconds.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The channel pore is formed by TM3 and the loop between
CC       TM2 and TM3. After a sharp turn at Gly-113, an alpha-helix
CC       (residues 114-127) is oriented nearly parallel to the plane of the
CC       putative lipid bilayer. On the intracellular side of the channel,
CC       the permeation pathway of mscS does not connect directly to the
CC       cytoplasm but instead opens to a large chamber that is connected
CC       to the cytoplasm. This chamber resembles a molecular filter that
CC       could serve to prescreen large molecules before they are allowed
CC       passage to the transmembrane pore. The TM1 and TM2 helices appear
CC       to be likely candidates for mediating the tension and voltage
CC       sensitivities of mscS. Gating requires large rearrangements of at
CC       least the C-terminus.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homoheptamer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the mscS (TC 1.A.23) family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

FT   MUTAGEN      40     40       V->C,G,N: No detectable phenotype.
FT   MUTAGEN      40     40       V->D,K: Normal growth stops, without cell
FT                                death, due to increased membrane
FT                                permeability to potassium ions and
FT                                protons (permeability tested only for D
FT                                substitutions).
FT   MUTAGEN      58     58       S->C: Readily forms disulfides with
FT                                cross-linkers, suggesting that individual
FT                                S-58 are only 3 Angstroms apart in the
FT                                closed state, versus 33 Angstroms apart
FT                                in the open state crystal structure.
FT   MUTAGEN     266    286       ISFPYPQMDVNFKRVKEDKAA->HHHHHHLE: Normal
FT                                levels of channels are expressed; they
FT                                recover more slowly than wild-type cells
FT                                after desensitization.
FT   MUTAGEN     266    286       ISFPYPQMDVNFKRVKEDKAA->LE: Fewer channels
FT                                present in the membrane, they require
FT                                slightly more pressure to open and do not
FT                                recover after desensitization.
FT   MUTAGEN     267    267       S->C: Provides biochemical evidence for
FT                                heptameric structure upon cross-linking.

ID   MTHK_METTH              Reviewed;         336 AA.
AC   O27564;
DT   20-JUN-2002, integrated into UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot.

DT   02-MAR-2010, entry version 88.
DE   RecName: Full=Calcium-gated potassium channel mthK;
GN   Name=mthK; OrderedLocusNames=MTH_1520;
OS   Methanobacterium thermoautotrophicum.
OC   Archaea; Euryarchaeota; Methanobacteria; Methanobacteriales;
OC   Methanobacteriaceae; Methanothermobacter.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=187420;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE GENOMIC DNA].
RC   STRAIN=Delta H;
RX   MEDLINE=98037514; PubMed=9371463;
RA   Smith D.R., Doucette-Stamm L.A., Deloughery C., Lee H.-M., Dubois J.,
RA   Aldredge T., Bashirzadeh R., Blakely D., Cook R., Gilbert K.,
RA   Harrison D., Hoang L., Keagle P., Lumm W., Pothier B., Qiu D.,
RA   Spadafora R., Vicare R., Wang Y., Wierzbowski J., Gibson R.,
RA   Jiwani N., Caruso A., Bush D., Safer H., Patwell D., Prabhakar S.,
RA   McDougall S., Shimer G., Goyal A., Pietrovski S., Church G.M.,
RA   Daniels C.J., Mao J.-I., Rice P., Noelling J., Reeve J.N.;
RT   "Complete genome sequence of Methanobacterium thermoautotrophicum
RT   deltaH: functional analysis and comparative genomics.";
RL   J. Bacteriol. 179:7135-7155(1997).
RN   [2]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (3.3 ANGSTROMS), AND MUTAGENESIS OF MET-107 AND
RP   ASP-184.
RX   MEDLINE=22033683; PubMed=12037559; DOI=10.1038/417515a;
RA   Jiang Y., Lee A., Chen J., Cadene M., Chait B.T., MacKinnon R.;
RT   "Crystal structure and mechanism of a calcium-gated potassium
RT   channel.";
RL   Nature 417:515-522(2002).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Calcium-gated potassium channel.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotetramer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative initiation; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=Calcium-gated potassium channel;
CC         IsoId=O27564-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=Soluble; Synonyms=RCK domain;
CC         IsoId=O27564-2; Sequence=VSP_018901;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The channel is composed of 4 repeated units, each
CC       containing a transmembrane pore part and a gating ring part. The
CC       gating ring is composed of eight identical RCK (Regulators of K
CC       conductance) domains, in an alternating arrangement of one domain
CC       from each of the four subunits and four from the intracellular
CC       solution. Two protein interfaces between dimers of RCK domains
CC       from the pore-forming subunit and from the intracellular solution
CC       hold the ring together. One is called the fixed interface and the
CC       other the flexible interface. The flexible interface forms a cleft
CC       where calcium binds. Upon calcium binding the gating ring
CC       undergoes a conformational change that enables it to pull open the
CC       inner helices of the pore, allowing ion conduction.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: It is not known whether calcium is the
CC       physiological ligand.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Inhibited by charybdotoxin (CTX), a protein from
CC       scorpion venom.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 RCK C-terminal domain.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 RCK N-terminal domain.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

DE   RecName: Full=Respiratory nitrate reductase 1 gamma chain;

RP   TOPOLOGY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   STRAIN=K12 / MG1655 / ATCC 47076;
RX   PubMed=15919996; DOI=10.1126/science.1109730;
RA   Daley D.O., Rapp M., Granseth E., Melen K., Drew D., von Heijne G.;

RT   proteome.";

RN   [7]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.9 ANGSTROMS), AND METAL BINDING AT HIS-56;
RP   HIS-66; HIS-187 AND HIS-205.
RX   MEDLINE=22823317; PubMed=12910261; DOI=10.1038/nsb969;
RA   Bertero M.G., Rothery R.A., Palak M., Hou C., Lim D., Blasco F.,
RA   Weiner J.H., Strynadka N.C.J.;
RT   "Insights into the respiratory electron transfer pathway from the
RT   structure of nitrate reductase A.";
RL   Nat. Struct. Biol. 10:681-687(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The nitrate reductase enzyme complex allows E.coli to
CC       use nitrate as an electron acceptor during anaerobic growth. The
CC       gamma chain is a membrane-embedded heme-iron unit resembling
CC       cytochrome b, which transfers electrons from quinones to the beta
CC       subunit.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Nitrite + acceptor = nitrate + reduced
CC       acceptor.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 2 heme groups per subunit. Heme 1, called the
CC       proximal or heme Bp in PubMed:12910261, is located at the
CC       cytoplasmic interface, heme 2, called the distal or heme Bd, is
CC       located at the periplasmic interface. Electrons are transferred
CC       from the periplasmic to the cytoplasmic heme.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Dimer of heterotrimers each composed of an alpha, a beta
CC       and a gamma chain. Alpha and beta are catalytic chains; gamma
CC       chains are involved in binding the enzyme complex to the
CC       cytoplasmic membrane.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By nitrate.
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=Worthington enzyme manual;
CC       URL="http://www.worthington-biochem.com/NAR/";

RX   PubMed=17635927; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M704469200;
RA   Rimon A., Tzubery T., Padan E.;
RT   "Monomers of the NhaA Na+/H+ antiporter of Escherichia coli are fully

RN   [14]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (3.45 ANGSTROMS).
RX   PubMed=15988517; DOI=10.1038/nature03692;
RA   Hunte C., Screpanti E., Venturi M., Rimon A., Padan E., Michel H.;
RT   "Structure of a Na+/H+ antiporter and insights into mechanism of
RT   action and regulation by pH.";
RL   Nature 435:1197-1202(2005).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Na(+)/H(+) antiporter that extrudes sodium in exchange
CC       for external protons. Catalyzes the exchange of 2 H(+) per Na(+).
CC       Can mediate sodium uptake when a transmembrane pH gradient is
CC       applied. Active at alkaline pH. Activity is strongly down-
CC       regulated below pH 6.5.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer and homodimer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Transcription stimulated by high Na(+) concentrations.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nhaA Na(+)/H(+) (TC 2.A.33) antiporter
CC       family.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for the action of colicins K and L and for the
CC       stabilization of mating aggregates in conjugation. Serves as a
CC       receptor for a number of T-even like phages. Also acts as a porin
CC       with low permeability that allows slow penetration of small
CC       solutes.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P78285:arrD; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-371347, EBI-1118665;
CC       P0A850:tig; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-371347, EBI-544862;
CC       P05847:ttdA; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-371347, EBI-1113137;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell outer membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=35177; Method=Electrospray; Range=22-346;
CC       Source=PubMed:10757971;
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the ompA family.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 OmpA-like domain.

RN   [2]
RP   TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RC   TISSUE=Retina;
RX   PubMed=12939366; DOI=10.1242/jeb.00571;
RA   White R.H., Xu H., Munch T.A., Bennett R.R., Grable E.A.;
RT   "The retina of Manduca sexta: rhodopsin expression, the mosaic of
RT   green-, blue- and UV-sensitive photoreceptors, and regional
RT   specialization.";
RL   J. Exp. Biol. 206:3337-3348(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Visual pigments are the light-absorbing molecules that
CC       mediate vision. They consist of an apoprotein, opsin, covalently
CC       linked to cis-retinal. May play a role in photoperiodic
CC       photoreception.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       (Potential).
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: In the retina, expression is abundant and
CC       uniform in the anterior-posterior and oblique cells of the
CC       retinulae, with some expression in the proximal cells. There is no
CC       expression in the dorsal rim retinulae (at protein level).
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the G-protein coupled receptor 1 family.
CC       Opsin subfamily.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Photoreceptor required for image-forming vision at low
CC       light intensity. Required for photoreceptor cell viability after
CC       birth. Light-induced isomerization of 11-cis to all-trans retinal
CC       triggers a conformational change leading to G-protein activation
CC       and release of all-trans retinal (By similarity).
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Absorption:
CC         Abs(max)=495 nm;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Rod shaped photoreceptor cells which mediates
CC       vision in dim light.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on some or all of the serine and threonine
CC       residues present in the C-terminal region.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the G-protein coupled receptor 1 family.
CC       Opsin subfamily.

RP   INTERACTION WITH OST2; OST3; OST5; OST6; STT3; WBP1 AND SWP1.
RX   PubMed=15886282; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0502669102;
RA   Yan A., Wu E., Lennarz W.J.;
RT   "Studies of yeast oligosaccharyl transferase subunits using the split-
RT   ubiquitin system: topological features and in vivo interactions.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 102:7121-7126(2005).
RN   [14]
RP   STRUCTURE BY NMR, AND TRANSMEMBRANE DOMAIN.
RX   PubMed=15001703; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0400512101;
RA   Zubkov S., Lennarz W.J., Mohanty S.;
RT   "Structural basis for the function of a minimembrane protein subunit
RT   of yeast oligosaccharyltransferase.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 101:3821-3826(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Essential subunit of N-oligosaccharyl transferase enzyme
CC       which catalyzes the transfer of a high mannose oligosaccharide to
CC       an asparagine residue within an Asn-X-Ser/Thr consensus motif in
CC       nascent polypeptide chains. N-glycosylation occurs
CC       cotranslationally and the complex associates with the Sec61
CC       complex at the channel-forming translocon complex that mediates
CC       protein translocation across the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). All
CC       subunits are required for a maximal enzyme activity. OST4 is
CC       required for recruitment of OST3 or OST6 to the OST complex. It is
CC       essential for cell growth at 37 but not at 25 degrees Celsius.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Dolichyl diphosphooligosaccharide + protein L-
CC       asparagine = dolichyl diphosphate + a glycoprotein with the
CC       oligosaccharide chain attached by N-glycosyl linkage to protein L-
CC       asparagine.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Protein modification; protein glycosylation.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the oligosaccharyl transferase (OST)
CC       complex, which apears to exist in two assemblies comprising OST1,
CC       OST2, OST4, OST5, STT3, SWP1, WPB1, and either OST3 or OST6. OST3,
CC       OST4 and STT3 probably form a subcomplex. May interact directly
CC       with OST2, OST3, OST5, OST6, STT3, WBP1 and SWP1. Interacts with
CC       SEC61, SBH1 and SSS1.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Self; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-12689, EBI-12689;
CC       P48439:OST3; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-12689, EBI-12680;
CC       P52870:SBH1; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-12689, EBI-16410;
CC       P32915:SEC61; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-12689, EBI-16400;
CC       P35179:SSS1; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-12689, EBI-16406;
CC       P39007:STT3; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-12689, EBI-18447;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Single-pass
CC       membrane protein.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Present with 2430 molecules/cell in log phase SD
CC       medium.

RX   PubMed=11567087; DOI=10.1110/ps.17701;
RA   Snijder H.J., Van Eerde J.H., Kingma R.L., Kalk K.H., Dekker N.,
RA   Egmond M.R., Dijkstra B.W.;

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Has broad substrate specificity including hydrolysis of
CC       phosphatidylcholine with phospholipase A2 (EC 3.1.1.4) and
CC       phospholipase A1 (EC 3.1.1.32) activities. Strong expression leads
CC       to outer membrane breakdown and cell death; is dormant in normal
CC       growing cells. Required for efficient secretion of bacteriocins.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 2-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 1 calcium ion per monomer. In the dimeric form the
CC       calcium is bound by different amino acids with binding of each
CC       calcium shared with ligands coming from each monomer (Arg-167 and
CC       Ser-172 from 1 monomer, Ser-126 of the other). The calcium ion may
CC       have a role in catalysis.
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: By membrane damage, for example, by phage-
CC       induced lysis or temperature shock. The protein is inactive in the
CC       monomeric form and active in the dimeric form; calcium is
CC       essential for dimer stability.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer; dimerization is reversible, and the dimeric
CC       form is the active one.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P37641:yhjC; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-1119179, EBI-849303;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell outer membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein. Note=One of the very few enzymes located there.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A1 family.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May play an important role in regulating or promoting
CC       cell proliferation in some normal and neoplastically transformed
CC       cells.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Arachidonate + AH(2) + 2 O(2) = prostaglandin
CC       H(2) + A + H(2)O.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 1 heme B (iron-protoporphyrin IX) group per
CC       subunit.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Lipid metabolism; prostaglandin biosynthesis.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein. Microsome membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: This enzyme acts both as a dioxygenase and as a
CC       peroxidase.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: This enzyme is the target of nonsteroidal anti-
CC       inflammatory drugs such as aspirin.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the prostaglandin G/H synthase family.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 EGF-like domain.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RX   PubMed=10564517; DOI=10.1046/j.1365-2958.1999.01640.x;

RN   [11]
RP   MUTAGENESIS OF ASP-58; LYS-68; ALA-69; PHE-71; GLY-72; LYS-73; ASP-74;
RP   LYS-79; GLU-85; TYR-93; LYS-97; ASN-98; VAL-99; LYS-100; PHE-101;
RP   PHE-105 AND PHE-111.
RC   PLASMID=F;
RX   PubMed=11849547; DOI=10.1046/j.1365-2958.2002.02731.x;
RA   Manchak J., Anthony K.G., Frost L.S.;
RT   "Mutational analysis of F-pilin reveals domains for pilus assembly,
RT   phage infection and DNA transfer.";
RL   Mol. Microbiol. 43:195-205(2002).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Propilin is the precursor of the pilus subunit, pilin,
CC       that forms conjugative pili, the filamentous surface appendages
CC       required for cell-to-cell contact during the earlier stages of
CC       bacterial conjugation, and that retract after contact is
CC       established. Mature pilin is assembled with the help of traQ and
CC       traX.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. Interacts with itself to form filaments; also
CC       interacts with traQ.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell inner membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein. Secreted. Note=Propilin is directed to the inner
CC       membrane, where it is cleaved and acetylated. Mature pilin forms
CC       filaments that are secreted to form the conjugative pilus.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the traA family.

CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: A phosphate monoester + H(2)O = an alcohol +
CC       phosphate.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 1 magnesium ion (By similarity).
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 2 zinc ions (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Lipid-anchor, GPI-anchor.
CC   -!- POLYMORPHISM: Placental ALP is highly polymorphic, there are at
CC       least three common alleles.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: In most mammals there are four different isozymes:
CC       placental, placental-like, intestinal and tissue non-specific
CC       (liver/bone/kidney).
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the alkaline phosphatase family.

RN   [8]
RP   SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, HOMODIMERIZATION, AND MUTAGENESIS OF ASP-176;
RP   GLY-177; GLU-178; GLU-179 AND VAL-185.
RX   PubMed=14979871; DOI=10.1042/BJ20031788;
RA   Liang Z., Veeraprame H., Bayan N., Li G.;
RT   "The C-terminus of prenylin is important in forming a dimer
RT   conformation necessary for endoplasmic-reticulum-to-Golgi transport.";
RL   Biochem. J. 380:43-49(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: General Rab protein regulator required for vesicle
CC       formation from the Golgi complex. May control vesicle docking and
CC       fusion by mediating the action of Rab GTPases to the SNARE
CC       complexes. In addition it inhibits the removal of Rab GTPases from
CC       the membrane by GDI1 (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. Interacts with VAMP2 (synaptobrevin-2), GDI1
CC       and PCLO (By similarity). Interacts with prenylated Rab proteins
CC       (including RAB5 and RAB6), and with the members of the Ras
CC       superfamily HRAS, RHOA, TC21, and RAP1A.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P01112:HRAS (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-476965, EBI-350145;
CC       Q9JKS6:Pclo (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-476965, EBI-2271602;
CC       P62834:RAP1A (xeno); NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-476965, EBI-491414;
CC       P61586:RHOA (xeno); NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-476965, EBI-446668;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       (By similarity). Cytoplasm (By similarity). Golgi apparatus (By
CC       similarity). Cytoplasmic vesicle, secretory vesicle, synaptic
CC       vesicle (By similarity). Note=According to PubMed:11535589, it is
CC       an integral membrane protein, while other authors showed that it
CC       is cytoplasmic and membrane-associated to Golgi and synaptic
CC       vesicles (By similarity).
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the PRA1 family.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Interaction with the Ras-like GTPases failed to be
CC       confirmed in other species.

RL   J. Biol. Chem. 274:7351-7360(1999).
RN   [6]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (4.0 ANGSTROMS).
RX   MEDLINE=99167504; PubMed=10066800; DOI=10.1074/jbc.274.11.7361;
RA   Klukas O., Schubert W.-D., Jordan P., Krauss N., Fromme P., Witt H.T.,
RA   Saenger W.;
RT   "Localization of two phylloquinones, QK and QK', in an improved
RT   electron density map of photosystem I at 4-A resolution.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 274:7361-7367(1999).
RN   [7]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.5 ANGSTROMS).
RX   MEDLINE=21312035; PubMed=11418848; DOI=10.1038/35082000;
RA   Jordan P., Fromme P., Witt H.T., Klukas O., Saenger W., Krauss N.;
RT   "Three-dimensional structure of cyanobacterial photosystem I at 2.5 A
RT   resolution.";
RL   Nature 411:909-917(2001).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: PsaA and psaB bind P700, the primary electron donor of
CC       photosystem I (PSI), as well as the electron acceptors A0, A1 and
CC       FX. PSI is a plastocyanin/cytochrome c6-ferredoxin oxidoreductase,
CC       converting photonic excitation into a charge separation, which
CC       transfers an electron from the donor P700 chlorophyll pair to the
CC       spectroscopically characterized acceptors A0, A1, FX, FA and FB in
CC       turn. Oxidized P700 is reduced on the lumenal side of the
CC       thylakoid membrane by plastocyanin or cytochrome c6.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: PSI electron transfer chain: 5 chlorophyll a, 1
CC       chlorophyll a', 2 phylloquinones and 3 4Fe-4S clusters. PSI core
CC       antenna: 90 chlorophyll a, 22 carotenoids, 3 phospholipids and 1
CC       galactolipid. P700 is a chlorophyll a/chlorophyll a' dimer, A0 is
CC       one or more chlorophyll a, A1 is one or both phylloquinones and FX
CC       is a shared 4Fe-4S iron-sulfur center (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The psaA/B heterodimer binds the P700 chlorophyll special
CC       pair and subsequent electron acceptors. PSI consists of a core
CC       antenna complex that captures photons, and an electron transfer
CC       chain that converts photonic excitation into a charge separation.
CC       The cyanobacterial PSI reaction center is composed of one copy
CC       each of psaA,B,C,D,E,F,I,J,K,L,M and X, and forms trimeric
CC       complexes (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cellular thylakoid membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein (By similarity).
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the psaA/psaB family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

RN   [6]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (4.0 ANGSTROMS).
RX   MEDLINE=99167504; PubMed=10066800; DOI=10.1074/jbc.274.11.7361;
RA   Klukas O., Schubert W.-D., Jordan P., Krauss N., Fromme P., Witt H.T.,
RA   Saenger W.;
RT   "Localization of two phylloquinones, QK and QK', in an improved
RT   electron density map of photosystem I at 4-A resolution.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 274:7361-7367(1999).
RN   [7]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.5 ANGSTROMS).
RX   MEDLINE=21312035; PubMed=11418848; DOI=10.1038/35082000;
RA   Jordan P., Fromme P., Witt H.T., Klukas O., Saenger W., Krauss N.;
RT   "Three-dimensional structure of cyanobacterial photosystem I at 2.5 A
RT   resolution.";
RL   Nature 411:909-917(2001).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: PsaA and psaB bind P700, the primary electron donor of
CC       photosystem I (PSI), as well as the electron acceptors A0, A1 and
CC       FX. PSI is a plastocyanin/cytochrome c6-ferredoxin oxidoreductase,
CC       converting photonic excitation into a charge separation, which
CC       transfers an electron from the donor P700 chlorophyll pair to the
CC       spectroscopically characterized acceptors A0, A1, FX, FA and FB in
CC       turn. Oxidized P700 is reduced on the lumenal side of the
CC       thylakoid membrane by plastocyanin or cytochrome c6.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: PSI electron transfer chain: 5 chlorophyll a, 1
CC       chlorophyll a', 2 phylloquinones and 3 4Fe-4S clusters. PSI core
CC       antenna: 90 chlorophyll a, 22 carotenoids, 3 phospholipids and 1
CC       galactolipid. P700 is a chlorophyll a/chlorophyll a' dimer, A0 is
CC       one or more chlorophyll a, A1 is one or both phylloquinones and FX
CC       is a shared 4Fe-4S iron-sulfur center (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The psaA/B heterodimer binds the P700 chlorophyll special
CC       pair and subsequent electron acceptors. PSI consists of a core
CC       antenna complex that captures photons, and an electron transfer
CC       chain that converts photonic excitation into a charge separation.
CC       The cyanobacterial PSI reaction center is composed of one copy
CC       each of psaA,B,C,D,E,F,I,J,K,L,M and X, and forms trimeric
CC       complexes (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cellular thylakoid membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein (By similarity).
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the psaA/psaB family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   -!- FUNCTION: The reaction center is a membrane-bound complex that
CC       mediates the initial photochemical event in the electron transfer
CC       process of photosynthesis.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 4 bacteriochlorophylls per trimer.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 2 bacteriopheophytins per trimer.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 1 iron ion per trimer.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 4 magnesium ions per trimer.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 2 ubiquinone per trimer.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterotrimer composed of subunits L, M, and H.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cellular chromatophore membrane; Single-pass
CC       membrane protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the reaction center puhA family.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

CC   -!- FUNCTION: The reaction center is a membrane-bound complex that
CC       mediates the initial photochemical event in the electron transfer
CC       process of photosynthesis.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 4 bacteriochlorophylls per trimer.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 2 bacteriopheophytins per trimer.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 1 iron ion per trimer.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 4 magnesium ions per trimer.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 1 menaquinone per trimer.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 1 ubiquinone per trimer.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterotrimer composed of subunits L, M, and H.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cellular chromatophore membrane; Single-pass
CC       membrane protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the reaction center puhA family.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: The reaction center is a membrane-bound complex that
CC       mediates the initial photochemical event in the electron transfer
CC       process of photosynthesis.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Reaction center is composed of four bacteriochlorophylls,
CC       two bacteriopheophytins, two ubiquinones, one iron, and two highly
CC       hydrophobic polypeptide chains (designated L and M).

CC   -!- FUNCTION: The reaction center is a membrane-bound complex that
CC       mediates the initial photochemical event in the electron transfer
CC       process of photosynthesis.

CC       two bacteriopheophytins, two ubiquinones, one iron, and three
CC       highly hydrophobic polypeptide chains (designated L, M, and H).

CC   -!- FUNCTION: The reaction center is a membrane-bound complex that
CC       mediates the initial photochemical event in the electron transfer
CC       process of photosynthesis.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Reaction center is composed of four bacteriochlorophylls,
CC       two bacteriopheophytins, two ubiquinones, one iron, and three
CC       highly hydrophobic polypeptide chains (designated L, M, and H).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cellular chromatophore membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein (By similarity).
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the reaction center pufL/M/psbA/D family.

RP   TOPOLOGY.
RX   MEDLINE=90005419; PubMed=2676514;
RA   Deisenhofer J., Michel H.;
RT   "Nobel lecture. The photosynthetic reaction centre from the purple
RT   bacterium Rhodopseudomonas viridis.";
RL   EMBO J. 8:2149-2170(1989).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The reaction center is a membrane-bound complex that
CC       mediates the initial photochemical event in the electron transfer
CC       process of photosynthesis.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Reaction center is composed of four bacteriochlorophylls,
CC       two bacteriopheophytins, two ubiquinones, one iron, and three
CC       highly hydrophobic polypeptide chains (designated L, M, and H).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cellular chromatophore membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein (By similarity).
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the reaction center pufL/M/psbA/D family.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RP   FUNCTION.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Guanine nucleotide-exchange factor (GEF) required for
CC       the formation or budding of transport vesicles from the ER. This
CC       function involves the cytoplasmic domain of the protein, which is
CC       thought to interact with the small GTP-binding protein SAR1.
CC       Required for autophagy.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Single-pass
CC       type II membrane protein. Golgi apparatus, cis-Golgi network
CC       membrane; Single-pass type II membrane protein. Note=Cycling
CC       between endoplasmic reticulum and the early Golgi.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: In the process of transport, SEC12 itself may
CC       migrate to the Golgi apparatus and function in subsequent
CC       transport events.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Present with 6160 molecules/cell in log phase SD
CC       medium.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the WD repeat SEC12 family.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 WD repeats.

RT   "A Sec63p-BiP complex from yeast is required for protein translocation
RT   in a reconstituted proteoliposome.";
RL   J. Cell Biol. 123:1355-1363(1993).
RN   [8]
RP   ASSOCIATION OF THE SEC62/63 COMPLEX WITH THE SEC61 COMPLEX.
RX   PubMed=7758110; DOI=10.1016/0092-8674(95)90077-2;
RA   Panzner S., Dreier L., Hartmann E., Kostka S., Rapoport T.A.;
RT   "Posttranslational protein transport in yeast reconstituted with a
RT   purified complex of Sec proteins and Kar2p.";
RL   Cell 81:561-570(1995).
RN   [9]
RP   LEVEL OF PROTEIN EXPRESSION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RX   MEDLINE=22923965; PubMed=14562106; DOI=10.1038/nature02046;
RA   Ghaemmaghami S., Huh W.-K., Bower K., Howson R.W., Belle A.,
RA   Dephoure N., O'Shea E.K., Weissman J.S.;
RT   "Global analysis of protein expression in yeast.";
RL   Nature 425:737-741(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Acts as component of the Sec62/63 complex which is
CC       involved in SRP-independent post-translational translocation
CC       across the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) and functions together with
CC       the Sec61 complex and KAR2 in a channel-forming translocon
CC       complex. A cycle of assembly and disassembly of Sec62/63 complex
CC       from SEC61 may govern the activity of the translocon. SEC66 is
CC       required to attach or retain SEC72 in the SEC63 complex. It is
CC       essential for growth at elevated temperatures.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the heterotetrameric Sec62/63complex
CC       composed of SEC62, SEC63, SEC66 and SEC72. The Sec62/63 complex
CC       associates with the Sec61 complex to form the Sec complex. Part of
CC       a complex consisting of KAR2, SEC63, SEC66 and SEC72.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P39742:SEC72; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-16647, EBI-16651;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Single-pass
CC       type II membrane protein.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Present with 7820 molecules/cell in log phase SD
CC       medium.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: To S.pombe SpBC409.21.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Putative guanine nucleotide-exchange factor (GEF)
CC       involved in the formation or budding of transport vesicles from
CC       the ER. Positive regulator of SAR1 probably through inhibition of
CC       the GTPase activation by SEC23.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Single-pass
CC       type II membrane protein. Golgi apparatus membrane; Single-pass
CC       type II membrane protein (Potential). Note=In the process of
CC       transport, SED4 itself may migrate to the Golgi apparatus and
CC       function in subsequent transport events.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the WD repeat SEC12 family.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 WD repeats.

RN   [9]
RP   FUNCTION IN CASPASE-1-INDEPENDENT APOPTOSIS.
RC   STRAIN=SL1344;
RX   PubMed=14662750; DOI=10.1083/jcb.200309161;
RA   Hernandez L.D., Pypaert M., Flavell R.A., Galan J.E.;
RT   "A Salmonella protein causes macrophage cell death by inducing
RT   autophagy.";
RL   J. Cell Biol. 163:1123-1131(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for entry into the host cell through
CC       presentation or delivery of sipC at the host cell plasma membrane.
CC       Along with sipC, is necessary for the transfer of other effector
CC       proteins into the host cell. Induces macrophage apoptosis either
CC       by binding and activating the proapoptotic enzyme caspase-1
CC       (caspase-1 dependent), resulting in the release of interleukin-1
CC       beta active form, or by disrupting mitochondria and inducing
CC       autophagy (caspase-1 independent). The former is dependent of its
CC       membrane-fusion activity. The sipBC complex, in association with
CC       its chaperone sicA, is regulated by binding of invE.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotrimer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted. Host cell membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein. Note=Secreted via the type III secretion system
CC       1 (SPI-1 TTSS), inserted into the phagosomal membrane and
CC       subsequently released into the host cell cytoplasm.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: SipB membrane integration requires both hydrophobic
CC       domains and the helical C-terminal region.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the invasin protein B family.

RP   VARIANT IXL ARG-380.
RX   MEDLINE=20304877; PubMed=10844566;
RX   DOI=10.1046/j.1523-1747.2000.00004.x;
RA   Oyama N., Satoh M., Iwatsuki K., Kaneko F.;

RT   X-linked ichthyosis: transfection analysis using the mutated genes.";
RL   J. Invest. Dermatol. 114:1195-1199(2000).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Conversion of sulfated steroid precursors to estrogens
CC       during pregnancy.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: 3-beta-hydroxyandrost-5-en-17-one 3-sulfate +
CC       H(2)O = 3-beta-hydroxyandrost-5-en-17-one + sulfate.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 1 calcium ion per subunit.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein.
CC   -!- PTM: The conversion to 3-oxoalanine (also known as C-
CC       formylglycine, FGly), of a serine or cysteine residue in
CC       prokaryotes and of a cysteine residue in eukaryotes, is critical
CC       for catalytic activity (By similarity).
CC   -!- DISEASE: Defects in STS are the cause of ichthyosis X-linked (IXL)
CC       [MIM:308100]. Ichthyosis X-linked is a keratinization disorder
CC       manifesting with mild erythroderma and generalized exfoliation of
CC       the skin within a few weeks after birth. Affected boys later
CC       develop large, polygonal, dark brown scales, especially on the
CC       neck, extremities, trunk, and buttocks.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the sulfatase family.
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=GeneReviews;
CC       URL="http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sites/GeneTests/lab/gene/STS";
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=Wikipedia; Note=Steroid sulfatase entry;
CC       URL="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steroid_sulfatase";

RN   [3]
RP   FUNCTION, IDENTIFICATION IN SNARE COMPLEX, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=12175335; DOI=10.1042/BJ20020845;
RA   Bogdanovic A., Bennett N., Kieffer S., Louwagie M., Morio T.,
RA   Garin J., Satre M., Bruckert F.;
RT   "Syntaxin 7, syntaxin 8, Vti1 and VAMP7 (vesicle-associated membrane
RT   protein 7) form an active SNARE complex for early macropinocytic
RT   compartment fusion in Dictyostelium discoideum.";
RL   Biochem. J. 368:29-39(2002).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in the targeting and/or fusion of transport
CC       vesicles to their target membrane during transport of proteins
CC       from the early endosome to the lysosome. Required for fusion of
CC       late endosomes with lysosomes and homotypic lysosomal fusion. May
CC       be involved in protein trafficking from the plasma membrane to the
CC       early endosome (EE) as well as in homotypic fusion of endocytic
CC       organelles.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the SNARE complex composed of syn7A, syn8A,
CC       vamp7A and vti1A. Interacts with nsfA, snpA and snpC.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q75JI3:nsfA; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-1810238, EBI-1810142;
CC       Q54NW7:vamp7A; NbExp=1; IntAct=EBI-1810238, EBI-1810311;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endosome membrane; Single-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the syntaxin family.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 t-SNARE coiled-coil homology domain.

RP   SUBUNIT, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RC   STRAIN=BL21-DE3;
RX   PubMed=16079137; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M506479200;
RA   Stenberg F., Chovanec P., Maslen S.L., Robinson C.V., Ilag L.,

RN   [9]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.1 ANGSTROMS) OF 23-450.
RX   MEDLINE=20335872; PubMed=10879525; DOI=10.1038/35016007;
RA   Koronakis V., Sharff A., Koronakis E., Luisi B., Hughes C.;
RT   "Crystal structure of the bacterial membrane protein TolC central to
RT   multidrug efflux and protein export.";
RL   Nature 405:914-919(2000).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for proper expression of outer membrane protein
CC       genes such as ompF, nmpC, protein 2, hemolysin, colicin V, or
CC       colicin E1. May be specialized for signal sequence independent,
CC       extracellular secretion in Gram-negative bacteria.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotrimer that assembles to form a continuous, solvent-
CC       accessible conduit: a 'channel-tunnel' over 140 Angstroms long
CC       that spans both the outer membrane and periplasmic space. The
CC       periplasmic or proximal end of the tunnel is sealed by sets of
CC       coiled helices.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell outer membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the outer membrane factor (OMF) (TC 1.B.17)
CC       family.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=CAA24914.1; Type=Miscellaneous discrepancy;

GN   Name=petC;
OS   Mastigocladus laminosus (Fischerella sp.).
OC   Bacteria; Cyanobacteria; Stigonematales; Mastigocladus.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=83541;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [GENOMIC DNA].
RA   Yan J., Zhang H., Cramer W.A.;
RT   "Cloning and characterization of the petBD and petCA operon from the
RT   thermophilic cyanobacterium Mastigocladus laminosus.";
RL   Submitted (SEP-2003) to the EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ databases.
RN   [2]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (3.0 ANGSTROMS).
RX   PubMed=14526088; DOI=10.1126/science.1090165;
RA   Kurisu G., Zhang H., Smith J.L., Cramer W.A.;
RT   "Structure of the cytochrome b6f complex of oxygenic photosynthesis:
RT   tuning the cavity.";
RL   Science 302:1009-1014(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the cytochrome b6-f complex, which mediates
CC       electron transfer between photosystem II (PSII) and photosystem I
CC       (PSI), cyclic electron flow around PSI, and state transitions.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Plastoquinol-1 + 2 oxidized plastocyanin =
CC       plastoquinone + 2 reduced plastocyanin.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 1 2Fe-2S cluster per subunit.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The 4 large subunits of the cytochrome b6-f complex are
CC       cytochrome b6, subunit IV (17 kDa polypeptide, petD), cytochrome f
CC       and the Rieske protein, while the 4 small subunits are petG, petL,
CC       petM and petN. The complex functions as a dimer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cellular thylakoid membrane; Single-pass
CC       membrane protein (By similarity). Note=The transmembrane helix
CC       obliquely spans the membrane in one monomer, and its extrinsic C-
CC       terminal domain is part of the other monomer.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The Rieske iron-sulfur protein is a high potential
CC       2Fe-2S protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 Rieske domain.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the cytochrome b6-f complex, which mediates
CC       electron transfer between photosystem II (PSII) and photosystem I
CC       (PSI), cyclic electron flow around PSI, and state transitions.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Plastoquinol-1 + 2 oxidized plastocyanin =
CC       plastoquinone + 2 reduced plastocyanin.
CC   -!- COFACTOR: Binds 1 2Fe-2S cluster per subunit.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The 4 large subunits of the cytochrome b6-f complex are
CC       cytochrome b6, subunit IV (17 kDa polypeptide, petD), cytochrome f
CC       and the Rieske protein, while the 4 small subunits are petG, petL,
CC       petM and petN. The complex functions as a dimer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Plastid, chloroplast thylakoid membrane;
CC       Single-pass membrane protein. Note=The transmembrane helix
CC       obliquely spans the membrane in one monomer, and its extrinsic C-
CC       terminal domain is part of the other monomer.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: This protein is 1 of 2 subunits of the cytochrome
CC       b6-f complex that are encoded in the nucleus.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The Rieske iron-sulfur protein is a high potential
CC       2Fe-2S protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 Rieske domain.

RP   SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, INTERACTION WITH EMD; LMNA AND SYNE2, DOMAIN,
RP   AND ASSOCIATION WITH THE NUCLEOSKELETON.
RX   PubMed=19933576; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M109.071910;
RA   Haque F., Mazzeo D., Patel J.T., Smallwood D.T., Ellis J.A.,
RA   Shannahan C.M., Shackleton S.;
RT   "Mammalian SUN protein networks at the inner nuclear membrane and
RT   their role in laminopathy disease processes.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 0:0-0(2010).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of SUN-protein-containing multivariate
CC       complexes also called LINC complexes which link the nucleoskeleton
CC       and cytoskeleton by providing versatile outer nuclear membrane
CC       attachment sites for cytoskeletal filaments. Required for
CC       interkinetic nuclear migration (INM) and essential for
CC       nucleokinesis and centrosome-nucleus coupling during radial
CC       neuronal migration in the cerebral cortex and during glial
CC       migration. Anchors chromosome movement in the prophase of meiosis
CC       and is involved in selective gene expression of coding and non-
CC       coding RNAs needed for gametogenesis. Required for telomere
CC       attachment to nuclear envelope and gametogenesis. Helps to define
CC       the distribution of nuclear pore complexes (NPCs) (By similarity).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Dimers and tetramers (By similarity). Component of LINC
CC       complexes composed of SUN domain-containing proteins (UNC84A/SUN1
CC       or UNC84B/SUN2) coupled to KASH domain-containing proteins (SYNE1,
CC       SYNE2 or SYNE3) also called nesprins. Interacts with TSNAX (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with EMD, LMNA, NAT10, SYNE1, SYNE2 and
CC       SYNE3. Associates with the nuclear pore complex (NPC) (By
CC       similarity).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus inner membrane; Single-pass type II
CC       membrane protein.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=5;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=O94901-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=O94901-2; Sequence=VSP_007743, VSP_007744;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=O94901-3; Sequence=VSP_007745, VSP_007746;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=O94901-4; Sequence=VSP_007741, VSP_007742;
CC       Name=5;
CC         IsoId=O94901-5; Sequence=VSP_037867, VSP_037868;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The SUN domain may play a role in the nuclear anchoring
CC       and/or migration.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 SUN domain.
